website_summaries.verdict: Tough engine enamel paint for use in high temperature areas where you're worried about peeling.
pros: Provides resistance to most common automotive fluids, including oil
Maintains its integrity in temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit
Paint is available in multiple colors
Provides a high gloss type of look that you'll really like
cons: A little more expensive than some other options
Some colors are almost too bright and glossy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect turquoise color
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a Vintage Nomad camper. We've been remodeling the interior it's original colors were just awful. Yellows/Browns/Orange blah! Since the appliances are nearly impossible to replace I thought we'd give this a try. The Turquoise color is perfect and 1 can was enough to cover everything with 2 coats. Fridge ...Stove top ...oven door ...heater grill. I'll definitely be finding another reason to use this paint. Would recommend to a friend. *I've thrown in a before picture at the end <3
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: For Artwork Purposes: Not good when in contact with cold water
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this for art projects, please note that it is heat resistant BUT not water resistant. If you coat a coaster or tile with this to protect your art project, the look is excellent and it is heat resistant. However, any cold water that sits on it will disintegrate the coating and demolish the artwork.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this paint for everything! Calipers done in yellow.
customer_reviews.text: This engine enamel alone is such a great product! I use the paint for several different projects around the car to include the brake calipers. I know they make a caliper paint however it doesn't always come in your color, so thankfully we have this stuff available. It's a great product under the hood for sure but as you see in the pictures I used the yellow enamel to help accent the aftermarket wheels on the BMW.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my motorcycle. I sprayed on my engine cover, wheels, and other metal parts and it looks great. Keep in mind tough that Ceramic Engine paint needs heat to cure the paint so if you are going to spray things besides the engine you might want to research if heating the metal up with a heatgun would be beneficial to insure long lasting paint job.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: crinkled after 2nd coat after proper application. Refunded
customer_reviews.text: My husband painted and prepped my wheels for me to paint (He has done a LOT of painting in his life). The paint was not applied thick or anything to make it crinkle like it did. After the 2nd coat all 4 wheels had crinkled paint. We had to resand them down and repaint the wheels with another product. I am suspecting that the paint was either old or had something wrong with it. I wouldn't recommend buying this product. I was refunded however
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: double check your coloring guys this is nothing similar to cummins red despite what people say.
customer_reviews.text: I bought chryer industrial red, which is supposed to be the same as cummins red. Not really I thought it looked a bit orange and figured maybe it just needs to dry a bit? Nah its dry and looks like chevy orange. Yall have any idea how hard it is stripping this down to metal for paint? Now I need to re purchase wax and grease remover, rags, primer, and paint. Or I just deal with a stupid orange cummins.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Spence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect my my application ...
customer_reviews.text: I restore vintage bench planes and this specific paint is the closest thing I've found that duplicates the original "chinaing" process that was used for the better part of a century to protect the tool. This paint flowed well with a predictable pattern, set up fast enough to apply subsequent coats in just a few minutes and the outcome was nothing short of flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Hawki Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Very nice caliper paint in Pontiac blue!
customer_reviews.text: I have used quite a few other brands most have been brushed on but I've been getting excellent results with this in the Pontiac blue color. The durability, shine, and the ease of application are very good if you use thin coats and wait , you will be fine. Do not try to glob it all on at once or you will definitely get drip marks. Paint seems to hold up well . These pictures do not do it justice. This almost looks multicolor like a mirage paint up close especially if you have used it over top of silver or newer brake calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Georgyo07

customer_reviews.title: Awesome paint for firearms!
customer_reviews.text: This is an aluminum receiver from a 1966 Sears Ted Williams 12 gauge shotgun. The aluminum was pretty beat so I sanded it down and then painted it with this semi gloss Dupli Color. I was EXTREMELY happy with the way this turned out. I refinished a 1962 Remington 572 last month using Brownell's Aluma Hyde Ii and this paint was SOOO much easier to work with, and a much smoother more satin finish. FYI, I didn't use any primer and that is 3 coats. It's been drying for 10 days in my living room so I'll be slapping it back together soon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zang

customer_reviews.title: Worst paint I've used in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Use duplicolor paint often, saw this ceramic engine paint, doing a custom boat, wanted a nice red. 1st it dried matte which I was not happy about but just dealt with it. Paint been on the engine now about 2 months, have yet to start, so no heat or fluid issues, but this crap literally falls off, total crap ! I primed with their primer and painted in 70 deg weather...stuff is just garbage in my opinion. eventually I will have to pull engine and strip this crap off and start over.
customer_reviews.author: robert sheffield jr

customer_reviews.title: Chrysler Blue didn’t match well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Chrysler Blue. The paint doesn’t match very well. More of a Royal Blue than the Chrysler color. I’ve been working on and restoring old Dodges and Plymouths since the early 80s and so I’ve seen and painted quite a few engines and this didn’t match. It’s a very glossy finish for engine paint too. That being said, it’s a quality paint and sprays and covers easily. Dries quickly so follow the instructions on the can. Other colors I’ve used matched better so maybe just the Chrysler Blue doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Al P

customer_reviews.title: This paint never dries!
customer_reviews.text: This paint is terrible. I painted a balancer at about 8AM this morning, about 75 degrees out. Two light cotas. Two hours later, paint is still wet. Came back at 6PM, paint is still wet? I have been detailing engine bays for years and have never encountered this before. I have used dupli-color before and have never encountered this. Worst thing - this product isn't eligible for return because it requires "special handling". Of course, it came to me via UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality paint. Just not color I was really looking for.
customer_reviews.text: The paint was nice and it’s stayed on pretty well... except for when a dummy head at a repair shop used a pressure washer to clean my tires. (But that’s another story) even then the paint didn’t come off all the way it just seemed to peel in some places. The Pontiac Blue is more silver than blue which was kind of disappointing. I liked it, but I wanted more of a stand out blue on my for my mazda3 calipers. Going to be trying the Torque n teal next.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT use the clear coat!
customer_reviews.text: The DE1636 clear coat is horrifically had. I wish I listened to other reviews about it. Unless you want your paint to have a yellow hue to it, do not use this at all costs! I sprayed this over Duplicolor’s universal white and it made my entire paint job go from white to yellow tinted white. Absolutely do not use this unless you’re OK with a very strong yellow tint!
customer_reviews.author: Logan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Too Tricky to Work With
customer_reviews.text: The low gloss black was a perfect color but paint was impossible to work with. Three attempts on a test piece had the same results. It either orange peeled or completely crinkled with the second coat. I also noticed it will not dry, even if left overnight. I was able to force it to dry with a heat gun. The temp in the garage is 63 F and the can says from 60 to 95 F. I'm glad I didn't go ahead and try this on my valve covers. I would have wasted hours of prep.
customer_reviews.author: Louis V. Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Teal is not as shown in picture, waiting on replacement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Torque'n'Teal because the picture showed it to be a nice, light blue. When I received the product, it was significantly greener, as shown in the picture I've added. I will update this review once I get a different color that will hopefully be more accurate to what I want. My customer service representative Ryan was helpful in getting me a refund, even though returns are not accepted because the spray paint is considered a hazmat.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Connors

customer_reviews.title: Works as I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to renew a 7 year old Weber Genesis Stainless gas grill castings that have oxidized. I give it a 5 for color match and a 5 for ease and heat resistance. It's only been a month so jury is out on longevity. I have used 10 or more times at 5 to 600 degrees with no discoloration. 1/7/2014 The finish is still holding up despite lots of use and about 3/4 year. Some discoloration due to smoke from the grill but no more than when the original finish was new.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Discharged on it's own
customer_reviews.text: I used this spray twice to coat a small 4 x 4 sized art project. The next day I smelled a strong chemical odor coming from the room where the can was sitting. Was horrified to find it had completely discharged on it's own. The can was empty and engine spray had saturated my craft table. Do not buy this product. Faulty valve!
customer_reviews.author: E.Miles

customer_reviews.title: Used to paint an old Nutone Wall Oven vent hood ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to paint an old Nutone Wall Oven vent hood, that was Coppertone and Stainless Steel, to match a new Maytag Black wall oven. I lightly sanded all the surfaces and painted in a cardboard box, to contain the spray. Using more than 2 coats will result in a glossy finish. Lighter coats will result in a satin finish. Very uniform particle size and spray.
customer_reviews.author: Sol

customer_reviews.title: Nice color! Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: Great color! I painted the valve covers on my wifes jeep when we rebuilt the engine. Not gonna lie it takes a lbouta day in room temperature and dry to completely cure, i painted it at night and left it and it scratched really easy, so I sanded it a little and let it dry for 2 full days and put it in the sun a little bit, now its tough as nails.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kantz

customer_reviews.title: Great on PC parts.
customer_reviews.text: Use these on some PC parts (radiators mostly). Drys fast. Even coating. No cracking effects even if you over-spray or spray too close. Get a spray paint respirator mask because I could still smell a bit of the fumes through my own 3M respirator. Also, don't spray indoors. Outdoors only because the fumes last a bit.
customer_reviews.author: S.768

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Paint
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brand of paint. Results in very nice finish. After 2-3 light coats, apply a really heavy wet coat. Sprays very well and goes on thick without running. Winds up looking like a good powder coat job. I use on steam engines that run at 300 degrees. I also apply high temperature primer.
customer_reviews.author: CptnRon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results for a cheap mod!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stuff! Painted my brake calipers with this thing for my bmw! It lasted enough for all 4 calipers and been on for a couple months, only downside is all the brake dust gets on it and kinda hard to clean but still looks amazing, as a detailer just hit it with some degreaser and most of the brake dust will come off and show that nice color. Definitely cant go wrong for under 10$! If your thinking about getting this, do it!
customer_reviews.author: livewithfaith

customer_reviews.title: Has a nice easy touch nozzle from the old days!
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1) Has a nice easy touch nozzle from the old days! With this type of nozzle, spray paint can be more easily applied versus using the usual spray paint can nozzles. 2) Excellent quick dry time for manipulating the item around for complete painting within approximately one hour. (10-15 minutes before the item can be handled or manipulated.) 3) Made in the US (Cleveland, Ohio) 4) Tough to find Diesel Green for matching radiant boiler piping, similar color of TACO pumps. CONS: Takes several light coats to coat, then instructions specify top off with one thick coat.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: High temp Paint applications.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to paint the Brake Calipers and Drums on my 2005 Toyota Tacoma X-Runner. Be sure to wire brush, clean/degrease surface and apply 2-4 coats of primer 1st and then also 2-4 coats of clear after applying the color paint. Follow directions on the can to allow proper cure time between coats. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kikel

customer_reviews.title: Paint Plugs up internal feed line no matter how much you shake the can.
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked but the paint spattered out. Even after several minutes of shaking, it was never a predictable spray. Would intermittently spatter out and would have to remove the paint and start over. The next day the internal line plugged up and it didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: swbca

customer_reviews.title: Dupli-Color used to make a fantastic spray can product
customer_reviews.text: Dupli-Color used to make a fantastic spray can product, so ordered this for a BBQ trailer instead of making a local purchase. First can, inconsistent spray pattern - some areas layed down great, other portions had a very rough orange-peel finish with lots of dry over-spray in non-painted areas. Though maybe I hadn't shaken the can enough, and humidity was right at upper limit specified, so waited for a drier day and tried again. Same results - sprays globs, then great, then globs again. Globs get much worse near end of can. It will work for now, but will be sanding this project down and re-painting with a different product and won't use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NOT HEAT RESISTANT! Fraudulent quality
customer_reviews.text: Either this is a bad batch or this spray paint is FRAUDULENT. DOES NOT withstand ANY heat! Sold by Amazon...perhaps Amazon needs to double check its supplier. Really bad/nasty product. Can't return it either after you've used up the can. Fraudulent product
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Shucks, Inconsistent color
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited because this paint started off looking great and just the right color. Unfortunately my excitement didn’t last long. No matter how long I shook the can; the color of the first 25% of the can was the only part that matched the cap. The remaining 75% was about six shades lighter, with intermittent spurts of “correct” darker color. I feel it’s important to note that the entire can was used in one sitting. Maybe I just got an old can? Also good to know in advance that this stuff smells SUPER TOXIC, so be sure to use in a well ventilated area and use proper respiratory protection. Definitely more potent than normal spray paint.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my interior trim on my Subaru. Easy to use, good adhesion, you have to do thin coats and be patient to put layers down. If you get too excited and spray too much it will bubble and run. Prep is key! The more time you spend on prep the better the results will be. My friends loved checking it out, I get lots of compliments, really good-looking color and perfect for me. Will buy more, (looking at you, rims;))
customer_reviews.author: Nataliya

customer_reviews.title: Pale in color
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in yellow pigment. The pictures all make it look like a rich, darker hue of yellow. In reality it’s the palest yellow you can imagine. Highly dissatisfied and wouldn’t recommend to anyone unless you’re looking for a pale yellow paint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Using on tiles after painting with alcohol paints , makes it so thee paint will not smear and have a gloss finish. Win win!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff if applied properly
customer_reviews.text: If applied to whatever surface you are painting properly it's great stuff. The black AK-47 and G3 magazines are there for an original color comparison. You can see I globbed on the Detroit Diesel Alpine Green on too much. Colors used: Racing Green (Hunter) - the center AK-47 and G3 magazines Detroit Diesel Alpine Green - far right magazines in both pictures Cast Coat Iron - the far left G3 magazine.
customer_reviews.author: John Jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: paint does not match and can not be returned
customer_reviews.text: Started a project with "NEW FORD GRAY" DE 1611. After using several cans that all matched fine. the most recent cans that I have purchased do not match. This seller will not allow you to return this item. An attempt to contact Duplicolor went unanswered. You may want to consider that future batches of the same color paint will not match previous batches. Almost finished with engine rebuild project and now I have all these blotches of a different darker shade of gray. Doesn't even match the cap!
customer_reviews.author: kirk

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product as the final coating on heat resistant coasters and hot plates. It goes on clear and smooth with no streaks. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best paint for high heat i have ever used on plastics or metal....
customer_reviews.author: GLOCK704

customer_reviews.title: Painted motorcycle exhaust
customer_reviews.text: I used this to black out a polished exhaust for my motorcycle. I followed directions to prep the surfaceI and few weeks and it has held up nicely i used 4 coats 2 light coats and 2 heavy coats over high temp matte black. There's signs of cracks flaking etc. I'm happy with the look
customer_reviews.author: VETmedic39

customer_reviews.title: Quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: Really good product definitely recommend to paint anything that’s high heat . I used it to give my big break kit a new look and it worked just fine. Primer and clear were also used.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin c

customer_reviews.title: Best Paint out there.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of spray paints in my 45 years of working on cars. Dupli-color is one of the best. It has good heat resistance. It drys fast which blows Rustoleum brand away. And the spray nozzle gives a real nice spray pattern. Cant say enough good about dupli-color. NOTE: your results will improve by using a base primer first.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Koelz

customer_reviews.title: Great paint.
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice paint. I cannot comment about heat resistance as the item I painted does not heat up. The paint has a nice fan spray tip. These spray so much nicer than the Rustoleum I tried originally. Coverage is excellent as well.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! I used this product to apply 5 coats to all four of my calipers after primer and finished with a clear gloss top coat. It’s been a week and they look incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Totally incompatible with the engine enamel clear coat. Sprayed this as a touch up on some already painted calipers and it immediately started stripping the existing engine enamel clear coat off the calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Spawne32

customer_reviews.title: Color not accurate at all
customer_reviews.text: The color is definitely not like the photo. I expected a bright aqua. The actual color was an ugly dull grayish blue-green. The product isn’t returnable either. My recommendation: don’t buy spray paint online.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Wipe the tip between coats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the primer, blue, and clear. Over all very happy with how this product is holding up. I will advise you wipe the tip between each coat to avoid paint build up causing can to spit or drip on your project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, will see if lasts and resists heat
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, will see if lasts and resists heat. Painted stainless steel camper stovetop. Messed it up three times, read directions, you have one hour window to get all coats on - 2 or 3 primer, 3 color, 3 clear coat. Get PDF on line, and use right primer - I used Self Etching DAP1690. You can wet sand and redcoat, but have to wait a week for it to cure.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: sprayed and covered well
customer_reviews.text: For me this was a big score. I am rebuilding a Kawasaki 1100zxi and this paint is a very close match to the factory engine color. a tad bit more blue but it looks 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Ok I guess
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty much a match for the interior of my 96 Dodge ram only thing is it scratches easy and some of it peeled off I don't know if I had to put clear coat on it if that's why
customer_reviews.author: Peg leg

customer_reviews.title: odd usage, but looks great so far.
customer_reviews.text: i used it to paint a cordless drill.... not what its intended but didnt know what to use. i seemed to spray way too much and it didnt have any runs, and it dried in literallly 5 minutes! i put 3 coats on and ill update on how good it holds sometime in the future but really wouldnt be fair to nub points off if that shortcoming arrose due to the fact that im not using it as intended.
customer_reviews.author: jason p

customer_reviews.title: Great! Never run out
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Grabber Green and clear coat, as well as Chevy blue. The blue didn't stretch as far as I had hoped but 2 cans of grabber can double coat my entire engine. Make sure second coat goes on evenly while it's still tacky. Dry weather sets the paint faster, and a second coat after it dries causes the second coat to crack. I liked the look though. Definitely use clear coat after, keeps the paint sealed in. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Swift

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product is much much greener than the picture portrays. Funny how Amazon sells this product, but won't take a return on said product. I was able to still negotiate a refund, but now am stuck with something I can't use. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Consistent coverage, seems to be quality paint.
customer_reviews.text: Used on an rv in hopes that this enamel paint would stand up to the So Cal desert sun better. Time will tell. Looks real nice though, good consistent finish. Used the wrong color the first time, so did it again with a different color. The first color was Detroit diesel, the second color was Pontiac blue.
customer_reviews.author: Love to teach

customer_reviews.title: Lays down very well, matches perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stuff. I don't know how well it holds up to heat and grease yet, but it lays down incredibly well and perfectly matches factory aluminum colored paint on motorcycle engines and wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Someone else

customer_reviews.title: Okay results, time will tell
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get even-texture or the coverage I expected (I'm a semi-pro refinisher), but the nozzle does shoot a decent, controllable pattern. Will be interesting to see how this holds up to boat-use (engine and manifolds usually don't exceed 175-180F, which is lower than a car-engine) and salt-water spray. I'll update this review next year!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well for engine accessories
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply smoothly following directions. This product is not affected by oil or engine heat, and maintains a nice appearance over time. I've used it for years.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Raymond

customer_reviews.title: It melted the base coat for brake calipers.
customer_reviews.text: It melted the base coat for brake calipers. I don't see in description which paint is it not compatible with. "items containing flammable liquids or gases cannot be returned to Amazon". Great!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Yoda

customer_reviews.title: Prep
customer_reviews.text: Had a friend paint my calipers and black out my rims. Absolutely love it the color! As long as you prep properly first and take your time itll come out fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Sessily Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: DIY painting
customer_reviews.text: Color came out great.. of course this is after applying the clear coat as well. Ls400 calipers painted and fitted onto my sc400
customer_reviews.author: John Saeturn

customer_reviews.title: no good
customer_reviews.text: it wud not come out of can as spray paint just globs of thick gunk dropped out. they shouldnt sell old paint thats been sitting a long time without shaking can.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: Dupli-Color DE1642 Ceramic Daytona Yellow Engine Paint 12 oz. Can
customer_reviews.text: Great paint application easy and good adhesion to metal. Six light coats worked good for the aluminum 2 stroke bicycle engine cylinder and head I used it on. GOOD STUFF!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Airgun Junky

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT MATCH ITEM DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: The item received does not even remotely match the color in the listing description! I immediately notified that I was returning for this reason and was told that item was not eligible for return!! It is one thing to not be eligible for return, but if item is listed at least show the correct color. I am sure I can use my imagination and use this can, but certainly not for what it was intended. Lesson learned. Do not buy paint from Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: robert coleman

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Comes out fast, it leaves a good finish, withstand heat very well!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: Did not protect brake calipers. Did not get hard as it should. I can run my nail and it would scratch a lil bit, not ideal for caliper protection.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Chevy Blue Too dark for 1978 Camaro
customer_reviews.text: The Chevy blue is a couple of shades too dark for my 1978 Camaro. The GM blue is a perfect match. Fine paint though.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: A bit darker then the can color.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color, well balanced and very purple. See my 98 chevy 1500 is a Cranberry red so the theme isn't red but amber or purple.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great quality - I returned mine because the color was not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine only because the color was not exactly what I was looking for. The picture of the spray can looks a little more metallic whereas I was not able to get that appearance during test sprays. The color is vivid and I may post a picture of my results. The quality of the spray and paint itself is superior to most brands I have tried. I also ordered black and gloss which were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Evan the Great

customer_reviews.title: Quality paint products!
customer_reviews.text: Product was used in an ongoing classic muscle car restoration project. It met my strict quality requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Parlous1

customer_reviews.title: It is amazing !!
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing !! I bought 2 mat colors (black-red) for my blazer 94 fullsize engine.. It's look perfect now
customer_reviews.author: Falah Alshammary

customer_reviews.title: Not as purple as I would of liked
customer_reviews.text: With the Dupli-color gray ceramic primer it did not come out as purple as I would of like. Purple has a little gray hue to it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: White is no good from Duplin-color
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several different colors of dupli-color and all were great, accept the white. When spraying, it splattered and clumped and was just out and out crappy. I ordered multiple cans and all were the same, so it wasn't just "that can". Do not waste money on the white. Every other color is fine.
customer_reviews.author: `Luke Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great for revitalizing your stove top
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my rental when the burner covers were worn and chipped. Made it look like new!
customer_reviews.author: Cindie B

customer_reviews.title: Great for any car project.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with an adhesive promotion spray before applying it. The gloss is amazing and the paint is solid. I refused to use Plasti dip.
customer_reviews.author: 10Till8

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: you got to get the high temp primer and the high temp clear coat and prep is the key for a good paint job but this product work great
customer_reviews.author: Darrin

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: works great! just remember to shake it hard for 1 min before every use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great paint. Sprays real nice used it on an engine block and it looks like a brand new motor !
customer_reviews.author: Samuel G

customer_reviews.title: Brake caliper paint
customer_reviews.text: Used to paint brake caliper on my Dodge challenger and worked great. Holding up perfectly for over a month now no issues at all. Clean and prep as directed and follow the coating instructions!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice color, but unfortunately didn't hit the shade i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It is nice paint, just not the shade i was trying to match. I bought a project muscle car and the paint in the engine area is a metallic blue. I have been trying to match it, but can't seem to find the right shade, this one happenned to be too light. But, i used Dupli Color on the intake manifold with a bright aluminum color, and it went on super smooth and looks great, so if i could i would give the brand 5 stars, just the color gets 4.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ribbke

customer_reviews.title: Engine red is clown car orange
customer_reviews.text: Engine red? More like clown car orange. Calipers were cleaned, primed with high temp primer, then painter "engine red"
customer_reviews.author: JS in KC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: The engine hasn't been put together yet so I cannot speak for the heat resistance. But the paint was exactly as it should be. Packaging was great. And delivery was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Good paint
customer_reviews.text: It's paint. For an engine. Used it to touch up an already installed engine. Has a more matte finish than I expected but not concerned about it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun O.

customer_reviews.title: Higher gloss than expected but did the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Quality, durable paint but just a tad more glassy than expected. Would go for a "low-gloss" next time for the look I wanted to achieve but I am not that upset about it. Good buy for reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Kind of gummed up and sprayed oddly.
customer_reviews.text: I have had really good luck with all other Duplicolor products. The Beige cans I had would gum up and spray some grey. Could have been weather related, but the other colors spray much better, and smoother. This could be by design, I am no expert.
customer_reviews.author: Jill R

customer_reviews.title: Good paint
customer_reviews.text: Good color, quick shipping and standing up well to the heat!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shura

customer_reviews.title: Good paint
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff painted my brake calipers now they look nice and new
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well on my Calipers
customer_reviews.text: I used this to seal the logo stickers and engine paint on my calipers. It gave my calipers a shiny finish and extended the life of my paint job. The stickers never pealed. I was told that it would make my white "SATURN" logo stickers yellow, but that has yet to happen and it's been over two years now. I have yet to use it on my engine, but it worked well on my calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Batson

customer_reviews.title: Very Old Date Code
customer_reviews.text: Went to use this spray can of Duplicolor Engine Paint, rattled it for at least two minutes before use. Went to spray first light coat and got massive amount of paint globs! Ruined all the prep work, now have to go back and strip to bare metal! Checked date code - can was 12 years OLD!!! No wonder awful paint spray pattern! Check you date code before use!!!
customer_reviews.author: chr

customer_reviews.title: Had a bad can, but the other one was good.
customer_reviews.text: The first can I used was good and the valve cover turned out looking great. When it came time to use the second can on the intake manifold it was awful, like almost no copper color to it at all, it was almost silver colored. I had to order more to redo the job. Otherwise I'm happy with the paint and looks like it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great adhesion
customer_reviews.text: Used to repaint valve covers. Super easy. Mercury orange too!
customer_reviews.author: Al hellebuyck

customer_reviews.title: Paint has a strong adhesive
customer_reviews.text: Painted my engine block and looks great. Best brand for the job.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to spray
customer_reviews.text: Color is a rich true gold not a reflective high polished gold. Easy to spray, quick to dry and looks great! Used this for my radiators and worked beautifully. Excellent product, and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Watson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Spray Pattern and Even Coverage
customer_reviews.text: The spray pattern is excellent and provides excellent coverage. Very glossy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. But with paint and accessories I will go to local store from now on
customer_reviews.author: Todd R.

customer_reviews.title: Great paint
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic and does everything it says. It sticks great, covers previous paint jobs great and covered my old red calipers with no issue. Only thing I will say is the color it sprays as is alot lighter than what is on the cap of the bottle. See my picture attached. Love the color it produced though!
customer_reviews.author: Lane Lamb

customer_reviews.title: ... a turbo with this stuff and it came out excellent with a great finish
customer_reviews.text: Painted a turbo with this stuff and it came out excellent with a great finish. Make sure not to apply too much in one area though as it will have drips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received a Empty Can.
customer_reviews.text: Received a used can - pretty much empty. I spray paint every day and I know the sound of the metal ball in an empty can and that is exactly what I received. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: MNY

customer_reviews.title: Properly prepped this seems to stick and last pretty well. Wanted to detail the engine compartment in ...
customer_reviews.text: Properly prepped this seems to stick and last pretty well. Wanted to detail the engine compartment in my CJ-10a and couldn't see painting the 4BT anything except cummins tan.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect paint match
customer_reviews.text: Dupli-Color EDE1615 Ceramic Aluminum Engine Paint - perfect match for a 17 year old BMW R1150. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. This paint is hard to find local.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks. This paint worked out great. Tried finding it local and no one carries it. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hayes

customer_reviews.title: sad looking fridge
customer_reviews.text: Used this to paint a very old, sad looking fridge. Worked great and our fridge looks beautiful now! Just make sure you tarp the surrounding areas VERY well - it gets everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Color did not match the cap. Quite a bit darker.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good paint, but the color did not match the cap. More brown than beige.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality paint. The gloss is nice and it dries quickly
customer_reviews.author: Richard Newton

product_meta.title: Dupli-Color DE1632 Ceramic Chrysler Industrial Red Engine Paint - 12 oz.
product_meta.description: Color:Chrysler Industrial RedDuplicolor engine enamels contain ceramic resins for maximum heat dissipation and gloss retention. A durable formula that resists temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit intermittently. Dupli Color engine enamel will not chip, flake, crack or peel when exposed to excess heat or automotive fluids.
feature_bullets: Resists temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit
This item is not for sale in Catalina Island

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,181 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
